page.title: 20Pontycymer in transition
page.content: Pontycymer today represents a community in transition. The sequence of pit closures has continued since the First World War, resulting in unemployment, out-migration, a low standard of living and an inadequate provision of amenities. "How Green Was My Valley" could have been written about this area, as the harsh economic ENVIRONMENT was lessened by the miners themselves, but as industry has retreated, it's scars are being hidden, and the old community spirit has been restored, so that the new greenery is being matched by a more optimistic attitude. Thanks are recorded to Mr L.V. Kelly, Miss C. Griffiths, First and Second Year Pupils of Pontycymer and especially to Karl Bibey and Paul Brain for unstinting efforts.
